resources.string:
Bottom line: Don\'t do anything on this network that you wouldn\'t want someone else seeing.

Open networks such as this have no security features enabled. This typically means that ALL DATA is readable by anyone nearby. The exception is if you are visiting a web site or service that uses encryption. Web sites that use encryption will always have a URL which begins with \"https\" rather than \"http\". Services will vary by provider - if you are not certain that they use encryption it is usually best to play it safe and wait until you are on a more secure network.

This network is safe to use for:
- General web browsing (news, sports, games)
- Viewing encrypted web sites (most email, facebook, etc.)
Bottom line: Proceed with caution! This network has minor protection that is easily broken.
Bottom line: You are probably safe, but be forewarned. This network can be rather easily hacked.
Bottom line: This network uses an excellent form of security. It's only real weakness is an easy password - make sure it's a good one.
Bottom line: You are most likely perfectly safe. However, this network uses an older form of WPA which has several known vulnerabilities.
Bottom line: Excellent encryption! AES is quite literally the gold-standard for securing communications.
